englishText: 314. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Throw a stone in return from where one comes to you because evil can be met only with evil.
arabicText: ٣١٤. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): رُدُّوا الْحَجَرَمِنْ حَيْثُ جَاءَ، فَإِنَّ الشَّرَّ لَا يَدْفَعُهُ إِلَّا الشَّرُّ.

chapter: Leadership of believers versus wealth for the wicked
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 316. Amīr al-mu’minim, peace be upon him, said: I am the ya‘sūb (leader) of the believers, while wealth is the leader of the wicked.
arabicText: ٣١٦. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): أَنا يَعْسُوبُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ، وَالْمَالُ يَعْسُوبُ الْفُجَّارِ.

chapter: Leadership of believers versus wealth for the wicked
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: as-Sayyid ar-Raḍī says: It means that the believers follow me while the wicked follow wealth just as the bees follow their “ya‘sūb” who is their leader. [1]
arabicText: قال السيد الرضي: ومعنى ذلك أن المؤمنين يتبعونني، والفجار يتبعون المال، كما تتبع النحل يعسوبها، وهو رئيسها.

chapter: Amīr al-mu’minīn warns against destitution's spiritual and intellectual harms
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 319. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said to his son Muḥammad ibn al-Ḥanafiyyah: O’ my son, I fear lest destitution overtakes you. So, you should seek Allāh’s protection from it, because destitution is deficiency of religious belief, perplexity of intelligence, and it is conducive to hatred of obstinate people.
arabicText: ٣١٩. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام) لِابْنِهِ مُحَمَّدِ ابْنِ الْحَنَفِيَّةِ: يَا بُنَيَّ إِنِّى أَخَافُ عَلَيْكَ الْفَقْرَ فَاسْتَعِذْ بِاللَّهِ مِنْهُ فَإِنَّ الْفَقْرَ مَنْقَصَةٌ لِلدِّينِ مَدْهَشَةٌ لِلْعَقْلِ دَاعِيَةٌ لِلْمَقْتِ.

chapter: Leadership authority and advisory roles in governance
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 321. ‘Abdullāh ibn al-‘Abbās once advised Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, against his views, so he said: You have only to advise me but then I have to see (what to do); and if I act against your advice you have to follow me. [1]
arabicText: ۳۲۱. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام) لِعَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْعَبَّاسِ، وَقَدْ أَشَارَ عَلَيْهِ فِي شَيْ‏ءٍ لَمْ يُوَافِقْ رَأْيَهُ: لَكَ أَنْ تُشِيرَ عَلَيَّ وأَرَى، فَإِنْ عَصَيْتُكَ فَأَطِعْنِي.

chapter: Amīr al-mu’minīn on the deception of the Khārijites
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 323. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, passed by the dead bodies of the Khārijites on the day of the battle of Nahrawān and said: Woe unto you! You have been harmed by him who deceived you.
arabicText: ٣٢٣. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام) وَقَدْ مَرَّ بِقَتْلَى الْخَوَارِجِ يَوْمَ النَّهْرَوَانِ: بُؤْساً لَكُمْ، لَقَدْ ضَرَّكُمْ مَنْ غَرَّكُمْ.

chapter: Amīr al-mu’minīn on the deception of the Khārijites
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: He was asked: O’ Amīr al-mu’minīn, who deceived them? Then, he replied: Satan, the deceiver, and the inner spirit that leads one to evil deceived them through passions, made it easy for them to get into sins, promised them victory and eventually threw them into the Fire.
arabicText: فَقِيلَ لَهُ: مَنْ غَرَّهُمْ يَا أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ؟ فَقَالَ: الشَّيْطَانُ الْمُضِلُّ، وَالْأَنْفُسُ الْأَمَّارَةُ بِالسُّوءِ، غَرَّتْهُمْ بِالْأَمَانِيِّ، وَفَسَحَتْ لَهُمْ فِي المَعَاصِيِ، وَوَعَدَتْهُمُ الْإِظْهَارَ، فَاقْتَحَمَتْ بِهِمُ النَّارَ.

chapter: Age of accountability ends at sixty
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 326. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: The age up to which Allāh accepts any excuse for a human being is sixty years.
arabicText: ۳۲۶. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): الْعُمْرُ الَّذِي أَعْذَرَ اللهُ فِيهِ إِلَى ابْنِ آدَمَ سِتُّونَ سَنَةً.

chapter: Divine provision for the poor through the wealth of the rich
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 328. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Allāh, the Glorified, has fixed the livelihood of the destitute in the wealth of the rich. Consequently, whenever a destitute remains hungry it is because some rich person has denied (him his share). Allāh, the Sublime, will question them about it.
arabicText: ۳۲۸. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): إِنَّ اللهَ سُبْحَانَهُ فَرَضَ فِي أَمْوَالِ الْأَغْنِيَاءِ أَقْوَاتَ الْفُقَرَاءِ، فَمَا جَاعَ فَقِيرٌ إِلَّا بِمَا مَنَعَ بِهِ غَنِي، وَاللهُ تَعَالَى سَائِلُهُمْ عَنْ ذلِكَ.

chapter: Divine opportunity for the intelligent in others' shortcomings
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 331. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: When the disabled fall short in performing acts of obedience to Allāh, the Glorified, it is a good opportunity given by Allāh for the intelligent to perform such acts.
arabicText: ۳۳۱. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): إِنَّ اللهَ سُبْحَانَهُ جَعَلَ الطَّاعَةَ غَنِيمَةَ الْأَكْيَاسِ عِنْدَ تَفْرِيطِ الْعَجَزَةِ.

chapter: Amīr al-mu’minīn on property sharers and accidents
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 335. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: There are two sharers in the property of every person — successors and accidents.
arabicText: ۳۳۵. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): لِكُلِّ امْرِئٍ فِى مَالِهِ شَرِيكَانِ، الْوَارِثُ وَالْحَوَادِثُ.

chapter: Two types of knowledge: absorbed and merely heard
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 338. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Knowledge is of two kinds — that which is absorbed and that which is just heard. The one that is heard does not give benefit unless it is absorbed.
arabicText: ٣٣٨. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): الْعِلْمُ عِلْمَانِ: مَطْبُوعٌ وَمَسْمُوعٌ وَلَا يَنْفَعُ الْمَسْمُوعُ إِذَا لَمْ يَكُنِ الْمَطْبُوعُ.

chapter: Beauty of destitution in chastity and riches in gratefulness
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 340. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: The beauty of destitution is chastity and the beauty of riches is gratefulness.
arabicText: ٣٤٠. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): الْعَفَافُ زِينَةُ الْفَقْرِ، وَالشُّكْرُ زِينَةُ الْغِنَى.

chapter: Warning against worldly greed and divine accountability
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 344. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: O’ groups of people, fear Allāh, for there is many a man who aspires for what he does not get, many a builder of a house who does not live in it, and many a collector of that which he shall just leave behind. Possibly he may have collected it wrongfully or by denying a right. He acquired it unlawfully and had to bear the weight of sins on account of it. Consequently, he returned (from this world) with that weight and came before Allāh with sorrow and grief. Loses he both this world and (also) the hereafter; that is a loss (which is) manifest. (Qur’ān, 22:11)
arabicText: ٣٤٤. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): مَعَاشِرَ النَّاسِ اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ فَكَمْ مِنْ مُؤَمِّلٍ مَا لَا يَبْلُغُهُ وَبَانٍ مَا لَا يَسْكُنُهُ وَجَامِعٍ مَا سَوْفَ يَتْرُكُهُ وَلَعَلَّهُ مِنْ بَاطِلٍ جَمَعَهُ وَمِنْ حَقٍّ مَنَعَهُ أَصَابَهُ حَرَاماً وَاحْتَمَلَ بِهِ آثَاماً فَبَاءَ بِوِزْرِهِ وَ قَدِمَ عَلَى رَبِّهِ آسِفاً لَاهِفاً قَدْ ﴿خَسِرَ الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةَ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْخُسْرَانُ الْمُبِينُ﴾.

chapter: Excess praise as sycophancy, deficiency as inability or envy
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 347. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: To praise more than what is due is sycophancy; to do it less is either because of inability to speak or of envy.
arabicText: ٣٤٧. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): الثَّنَاءُ بِأَكْثَرَ مِنَ الِاسْتِحْقَاقِ مَلَقٌ وَالتَّقْصِيرُ عَنِ الِاسْتِحْقَاقِ عِيٌّ أَوْ حَسَدٌ.

chapter: Oppressor's traits: disobedience, tyranny, and supporting injustice
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 350. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: The oppressor among the people has three signs: he oppresses his superior by disobeying him, and his junior by imposing his authority and he supports other oppressors.
arabicText: ٣٥٠. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): لِلظَّالِمِ مِنَ الرِّجَالِ ثَلاَثُ عَلاَمَاتٍ: يَظْلِمُ مَنْ فَوْقَهُ بِالْمَعْصِيَةِ، وَمَنْ دُونَهُ بِالْغَلَبَةِ وَيُظَاهِرُ الْقَوْمَ الظَّلَمَةَ.

chapter: Hypocrisy in criticizing others' flaws
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 353. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: The greatest defect is to regard that defect (in others) which is present in yourself. [1]
arabicText: ۳۵۳. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): أَكْبَرُ الْعَيْبِ أَنْ تَعِيبَ مَا فِيكَ مِثْلُهُ.

chapter: Officer's lavish house revealing wealth
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 355. One of the officers of Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, built a stately house, about which Amīr al-mu’minīn said:
arabicText: ۳۵۵. وَبَنَى رَجُلٌ مِنْ عُمَّالِهِ بِنَاءً فَخْماً فَقَالَ (عليه السلام):

chapter: Officer's lavish house revealing wealth
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: This is silver coins showing forth their faces. Certainly, this house speaks of your riches.
arabicText: أَطْلَعَتِ الْوَرِقُ رُؤُوسَهَا! إِنَّ الْبِنَاءَ يَصِفُ لَكَ الْغِنَى.

chapter: Fearing Allah in both ease and hardship
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 358. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: O’ people, let Allāh see you fearing at the time of happiness just as you fear Him at the time of distress. Certainly, he who is given ease (of life) and does not consider it as a means of slow approach towards tribulation (wrongly), considers himself safe against what is to be feared while he who is afflicted with straitened circumstances but does not perceive them to be a trial loses the coveted reward.
arabicText: ۳۵۸. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ لِيَرَكُمُ اللَّهُ مِنَ النِّعْمَةِ وَجِلِينَ كَمَا يَرَاكُمْ مِنَ النِّقْمَةِ فَرِقِينَ إِنَّهُ مَنْ وُسِّعَ عَلَيْهِ فِى ذَاتِ يَدِهِ فَلَمْ يَرَ ذَلِكَ اسْتِدْرَاجاً فَقَدْ أَمِنَ مَخُوفاً وَمَنْ ضُيِّقَ عَلَيْهِ فِى ذَاتِ يَدِهِ فَلَمْ يَرَ ذَلِكَ اخْتِبَاراً فَقَدْ ضَيَّعَ مَأْمُولًا.

chapter: Seeking blessings before supplicating to Allāh
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 361. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: If you have a need from Allāh, the Glorified, then begin by seeking Allāh’s blessing on His Messenger, may Allāh bless him and his descendants, then ask your need, because Allāh is too generous to accept one (seeking His blessing on His Messenger) of the two requests made to Him and deny the other.
arabicText: ٣٦١. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): إِذَا كَانَتْ لَكَ إِلَى اللهِ سُبْحَانَهُ حَاجَةٌ فَابْدَأْ بِمَسْأَلَةِ الصَّلاَةِ عَلَى رَسُولِهِ (صلى الله عليه وآله)، ثُمَّ سَلْ حَاجَتَكَ، فَإِنَّ اللهَ أَكْرَمُ مِنْ أَنْ يُسْأَلَ حَاجَتَيْنِ فَيَقْضِيَ إِحْدَاهُمَا وَيَمْنَعَ الْأُخْرَى.

chapter: Avoid unnecessary concerns about unlikely events
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 364. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Do not ask about things which may not happen because you have enough to worry about with what happens.
arabicText: ٣٦٤. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): لَا تَسْأَلْ عَمَّا لَا يَكُونُ، فَفِي الَّذِي قَدْ كَانَ لَكَ شُغُلٌ.

chapter: Divine rewards and punishments for obedience and sin
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 368. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Allāh, the Glorified, has laid down reward for obedience to Him and punishment for committing sins against Him in order to save men from His chastisement and to drive them towards Paradise.
arabicText: ۳۶۸. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): إِنَّ اللهَ سُبْحَانَهُ وَضَعَ الثَّوَابَ عَلَى طَاعَتِهِ، وَالْعِقَابَ عَلَى مَعْصِيَتِهِ، ذِيَادَةً لِعِبَادِهِ عَنْ نِقْمَتِهِ، وَحِيَاشَةً لَهُمْ إلَى جَنِّتِهِ.

chapter: Ali's admonition on piety and the afterlife
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 370. It is related that it was seldom that Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, ascended the pulpit and did not utter the following before his sermon:
arabicText: ۳۷۰. وَرُوِيَ أَنَّهُ (عليه السلام) قَلَّمَا اعْتَدَلَ بِهِ الْمِنْبَرُ إِلَّا قَالَ أَمَامَ الْخُطْبَةِ:

chapter: Ali's admonition on piety and the afterlife
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: O’ people, fear Allāh for man has not been created for naught so that he may waste himself, nor has he been left uncared for so that he may commit nonsensical acts. This world which appears beautiful to him cannot be the replacement of the next world which appears bad in his eyes, nor is the vain person who is successful in this world through his high courage like him who is successful in the next world even to a small extent.
arabicText: أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ، اتَّقُوا اللهَ، فَمَا خُلِقَ امْرُؤٌ عَبَثاً فَيَلْهُوَ وَلَا تُرِكَ سُدىً فَيَلْغُوَ وَمَا دُنْيَاهُ الَّتي تَحَسَّنَتْ لَهُ بِخَلَفٍ مِنَ الْآخِرَةِ الَّتي قَبَّحَها سُوءُ النَّظَرِ عِنْدَهُ، وَمَا الْمَغْرُورُ الَّذِي ظَفِرَ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا بأَعْلَى هِمَّتِهِ كَالْآخَرِ الَّذِي ظَفِرَ مِنَ الْآخِرَةِ بِأَدْنَى سُهْمَتِهِ.

chapter: Ibn Abī Laylā's exhortation on jihad and moral responsibility
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 373. Ibn Jarīr aṭ-Ṭabarī has, in his history (vol. 2, p. 1086; also Ibn al-Athīr in his history, vol. 4, p. 478), related from ‘Abd ar-Raḥmān ibn Abī Laylā, al-faqīh (the theologian), who was one of those who had risen with (‘Abd ar-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad) Ibn al-Ash‘ath to fight al-Ḥajjāj (ibn Yusuf ath-Thaqafī), that he (Ibn Abī Laylā) was exhorting people to jihād by recalling: On the occasion of encounter with the people of Syria I heard Amīr al-mu’minīn, may Allāh exalt his degree of rank among the righteous and may He reward him the reward of martyrs and men of truth, saying:
arabicText: ۳۷۳. وَرَوَى ابْنُ جَرِيرٍ الطَّبَرِيُّ فِي تَارِيخِهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى الْفَقِيهِ. وَكَانَ مِمَّنْ خَرَجَ لِقِتَالِ الْحَجَّاجِ مَعَ ابْنِ الْأَشْعَثِ. أَنَّهُ قَالَ فِيمَا كَانَ يَحُضُّ بِهِ النَّاسَ عَلَى الْجِهَادِ: إِنِّي سَمِعْتُ عَلِيّاً رَفَعَ اللَّهُ دَرَجَتَهُ فِي الصَّالِحِينَ وَأَثَابَهُ ثَوَابَ الشُّهَدَاءِ وَالصِّدِّيقِينَ، يَقُولُ يَوْمَ لَقِينَا أَهْلَ الشَّامِ:

chapter: Ibn Abī Laylā's exhortation on jihad and moral responsibility
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: O’ believers, whoever observes excesses being committed and people being called towards evil and disapproves it with his heart is safe and free from responsibility for it, and whoever disapproves of it with his tongue would be rewarded and he is in a higher position than the former but whoever disapproves it with his sword in order that the word of Allāh may remain superior and the word of the oppressors may remain inferior, catches hold of the path of guidance and stands on the right way, while his heart is lighted with conviction.
arabicText: أَيُّهَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ، إِنَّهُ مَنْ رَأَى عُدْوَاناً يُعْمَلُ بِهِ وَمُنْكَراً يُدْعَى إِلَيْهِ، فَأَنْكَرَهُ بِقَلْبِهِ فَقَدْ سَلِمَ وَبَرِىءَ وَمَنْ أَنْكَرَهُ بِلِسَانِهِ فَقَدْ أُجِرَ وَهُوَ أَفْضَلُ مِنْ صَاحِبِهِ، وَمَنْ أَنْكرَهُ بِالسَّيْفِ لِتَكُونَ كَلِمَةُ اللهِ هِيَ الْعُلْيَا وَكَلِمَةُ الظَّالِمِينَ هِيَ السُّفْلَى، فَذلِكَ الَّذِي أَصَابَ سَبيلَ الْهُدَى، وَقَامَ عَلَى الطَّريق، وَنَوَّرَ فِي قَلْبِهِ الْيَقِينُ.

chapter: Right's weight versus wrong's lightness
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 376. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Certainly, right is weighty and wholesome while wrong is light and epidemical.
arabicText: ۳۷۶. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): إِنَّ الْحَقَّ ثَقِيلٌ مَرِيءٌ وَإِنَّ الْبَاطِلَ خَفِيفٌ وَبِيءٌ.

chapter: Life's fleeting nature and sudden reversals
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 380. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Many a man faces a day after which he finds no day and many a man is in an enviable position in the earlier part of the night but is wept over by bewailing women in its later part.
arabicText: ۳۸۰. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): رُبَّ مُسْتَقْبِلٍ يَوْماً لَيْسَ بِمُسْتَدْبِرِهِ وَمَغْبُوطٍ فِي أَوَّلِ لَيْلِهِ قَامَتْ بَوَاكِيهِ فِي آخِرِهِ.

chapter: Balancing strength in obedience and weakness in sin
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 383. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Fear lest Allāh sees you while committing His sins or misses you when it is time to obey Him and as a result thereof you become a loser. Therefore, when you are strong be strong in obeying Allāh and when you are weak be weak in committing sins of Allāh.
arabicText: ۳۸۳. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): احْذَرْ أَنْ يَرَاكَ اللهُ عِنْدَ مَعْصِيَتِهِ، وَيَفْقِدَكَ عِنْدَ طَاعَتِهِ، فَتَكُونَ مِنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ، وَإِذَا قَوِيتَ فَاقْوَ عَلَى طَاعَةِ اللهِ، وَإِذَا ضَعُفْتَ فاضْعُفْ عَنْ مَعْصِيَةِ اللهِ.

chapter: Worldly humility and divine obedience
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 385. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: It is (the proof of the) humbleness of the world before Allāh that He is disobeyed only herein and His favours cannot be achieved except by abandoning it.
arabicText: ۳۸۵. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): مِنْ هَوَانِ الدُّنْيَا عَلَى اللهِ أَنَّهُ لَا يُعْصَى إِلَّا فِيهَا، وَلَا يُنَالُ مَا عِنْدَهُ إِلَّا بِتَرْكِهَا.

chapter: The hierarchy of calamities and blessings
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 388. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Beware that destitution is a calamity, but worse than destitution is ailment of the body, while worse than bodily ailment is the disease of the heart.
arabicText: ۳۸۸. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): أَلَا وإِنَّ مِنَ الْبَلاَءِ الْفَاقَةَ وَأَشَدُّ مِنَ الْفَاقَةِ مَرَضُ الْبَدَنِ، وَأشدُّ مِنْ مَرَضِ الْبَدَنِ مَرَضُ الْقَلْبِ.

chapter: The hierarchy of calamities and blessings
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: Beware that plenty of wealth is a blessing, but better than plenty of wealth is the health of the body, while still better than the health of the body is the chastity of heart.
arabicText: أَلَا وإِنَّ مِنَ النِّعَم سَعَةَ الْمَالِ، وَأَفْضَلُ مِن سَعَةِ الْمَالِ صِحّةُ الْبَدَنِ، وَأَفْضَلُ مِنْ صِحَّةِ الْبَدَنِ تَقْوَى الْقَلْبِ.

chapter: Avoiding worldly attachments to reveal true evils
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 391. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Abstain from the world so that Allāh may show you its real evils and do not be neglectful because (in any case) you will not be neglected.
arabicText: ۳۹۱. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): ازْهَدْ فِي الدُّنْيَا يُبَصّرْكَ اللهُ عَوْرَاتِهَا، وَلَا تَغْفُلْ فَلَسْتَ بِمَغْفُولٍ عَنْكَ.

chapter: Contentment with little suffices
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 395. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Every small thing that is contented upon, suffices.
arabicText: ۳۹۵. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): كُلُّ مُقْتَصَرٍ عَلَيْهِ كَافٍ.

chapter: Avoiding pride and remembering mortality
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 398. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Put off boasting, give up self-conceit and remember your grave.
arabicText: ۳۹۸. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): ضَعْ فَخْرَكَ، وَاحْطُطْ كِبْرَكَ، وَاذْكُرْ قَبْرَكَ.

chapter: Divine and worldly pleasures versus superstitions
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 400. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Evil effect of sight is right; charm is right; sorcery is right, and fa’l (auguring good) is right, while ṭiyarah (auguring evil) [1] is not right, and spreading of a disease from one to the other is not right. Scent gives pleasure, honey gives pleasure, riding gives pleasure and looking at greenery gives pleasure.
arabicText: ۴۰۰. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): الْعَيْنُ حَقٌّ، وَالرُّقَى حَقٌّ، وَالسِّحْرُ حَقٌّ، وَالْفَأْلُ حَقٌّ، وَالطِيَرَةُ لَيْسَتْ بِحَقٍّ، وَالْعَدْوَى لَيْسَتْ بِحَقٍّ، والطِّيبُ نُشْرَةٌ وَالْعَسَلُ نُشْرَةٌ، وَالرُّكُوبُ نُشْرَةٌ، وَالنَّظَرُ إِلَى الْخُضْرَةِ نُشْرَةٌ.

chapter: Desire for opposites hinders success
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 403. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Whoever hankers after contraries gets no means of success.
arabicText: ۴۰۳. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): مَنْ أَوْمَأَ إِلَى مُتَفَاوِتٍ خَذَلَتْهُ الْحِيَلُ.

chapter: Amīr al-mu’minīn's caution regarding al-Mughīrah's worldly motives
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 405. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, heard ‘Ammār ibn Yāsir (may Allāh have mercy on him) conversing with al-Mughīrah ibn Shu‘bah and said:
arabicText: ۴۰۵. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام) لِعَمَّارِ بْنِ يَاسِرٍ (رحمه الله) وَقَدْ سَمِعَهُ يُرَاجِعُ الْمُغِيرَةَ بْنَ شُعْبَةَ كَلَاماً:

chapter: Amīr al-mu’minīn's caution regarding al-Mughīrah's worldly motives
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: Let him alone O’ ‘Ammār, for he has entered religion only to the extent of his deriving advantage of the world, and he has willfully involved himself in misgivings in order to adopt them as cover for his shortcomings.
arabicText: دَعْهُ يَا عَمَّارُ، فَإِنَّهُ لَمْ يَأْخُذْ مِنَ الدِّينِ إِلَّا مَا قَارَبَهُ الدُّنْيَا، وَعَلَى عَمدٍ لَبَّسَ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ لِيَجْعَلَ الشُّبُهَاتِ عَاذِراً لِسَقَطَاتِهِ.

chapter: The heart as the eye's manuscript
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 409. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: The heart is the book of the eye.
arabicText: ٤٠٩. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): الْقَلْبُ مُصْحَفُ الْبَصَرِ.

chapter: Warning against challenging divine authority with speech
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 411. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Do not try the sharpness of your tongue against Him Who gave you the power to speak, nor the eloquence of your speaking against Him Who set you on the right path.
arabicText: ٤١١. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): لَا تَجْعَلَنَّ ذَرَبَ لِسَانِكَ عَلَى مَنْ أَنْطَقَكَ، وَبَلاَغَةَ قَوْلِكَ عَلَى مَنْ سَدَّدَكَ.

chapter: Enduring grief like noble beings
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 414. In another tradition it is related that Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said to al-Ash‘ath ibn Qays by way of condolence on the death of his son:
arabicText: ٤١٤. وَفِي خَبَرٍ آخَرَ أَنَّهُ (عليه السلام) قَالَ لِلْأَشْعَثِ بْنِ قَيْسٍ مُعَزِّياً (عَنِ ابْنٍ لَهُ)

chapter: Enduring grief like noble beings
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: Either endure like great people or else you will forget like animals.
arabicText: إِنْ صَبَرْتَ صَبْرَ الْأَكَارِمِ، وَإِلَّا سَلَوْتَ سُلُوَّ الْبَهَائِمِ.

chapter: Clemency as familial kinship
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 418. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Clemency is (like) a kinsfolk.
arabicText: ٤١٨. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): الْحِلْمُ عَشِيرَةٌ.

chapter: Wisdom distinguishing guidance from misguidance
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 421. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: It is enough if your wisdom distinguishes for you the ways of going astray from those of guidance.
arabicText: ٤٢١. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): كَفَاكَ مِنْ عَقْلِكَ مَا أَوْضَحَ لَكَ سَبِيلَ غَيِّكَ مِنْ رُشْدِكَ.

chapter: Forbearance and wisdom as moral virtues
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 424. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Forbearance is a curtain for covering, and wisdom is a sharp sword. Therefore, conceal the weaknesses in your conduct with forbearance and kill your desires with your wisdom.
arabicText: ٤٢٤. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): الْحِلْمُ غِطَاءٌ سَاتِرٌ، وَالْعَقْلُ حُسَامٌ قَاطِعٌ، فَاسْتُرْ خَلَلَ خُلُقِكَ بِحِلْمِكَ، وَقَاتِلْ هَوَاكَ بِعَقْلِكَ.

chapter: Complaining to believers versus unbelievers
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 427. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Whoever complains about a need to a believer, it is as though he has complained about it to Allāh; but whoever complains about it to an unbeliever it is as though he complained about Allāh.
arabicText: ٤٢٧. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): مَنْ شَكَا الْحَاجَةَ إِلَى مُؤْمِنٍ فَكَأَنَّمَا شَكَاهَا إِلَى اللهِ، وَمَنْ شَكَاهَا إلَى كَافِرٍ فَكَأَنَّمَا شَكَا اللهَ.

chapter: Futility of striving against fate for wealth
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 430. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: The worst in bargaining and the most unsuccessful in striving is the man who exerts himself in seeking riches although fate does not help him in his aims and consequently he goes from this world in a sorrowful state while in the next world too he will face its ill consequences. [1]
arabicText: ٤٣٠. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): إِنَّ أَخْسَرَ النَّاسِ صَفْقَةً وَأَخْيَبَهُمْ سَعْياً، رَجُلٌ أَخْلَقَ بَدَنَهُ فِي طَلَبِ آمَالِهِ، وَلَمْ تُسَاعِدْهُ الْمَقَادِيرُ عَلَى إِرَادَتِهِ، فَخَرَجَ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا بِحَسْرَتِهِ، وَقَدِمَ عَلَى الْآخِرَةِ بِتَبِعَتِهِ.

chapter: True believers' inward devotion and detachment from worldly pursuits
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 432. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: The lovers of Allāh are those who look at the inward side of the world while the other people look at its outward side, they busy themselves with its remoter benefits while the other people busy themselves in the immediate benefits. They kill those things which they feared would have killed them, and they leave here in this world what they think would leave them. They took the amassing of wealth by others as a small matter and regarded it like losing. They are enemies of those things which others love while they love things which others hate. Through them, the Qur’ān has been learnt and they have been given knowledge through the Qur’ān. With them the Qur’ān is staying while they stand by the Qur’ān. They do not see any object of hope above what they hope and no object of fear above what they fear.
arabicText: ٤٣٢. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): إِنَّ أَوْلِيَاءَ اللهِ هُمُ الَّذِينَ نَظَرُوا إِلَى بَاطِنِ الدُّنْيَا إِذَا نَظَرَ النَّاسُ إِلَى ظَاهِرِهَا، وَاشْتَغَلُوا بِآجِلِهَا إِذَا اشْتَغَلَ النَّاسُ بِعَاجِلِهَا، فَأَمَاتُوا مِنْهَا مَا خَشُوا أَنْ يُمِيتَهُمْ وَتَرَكُوا مِنْهَا مَا عَلِمُوا أَنَّهُ سَيَتْرُكُهُمْ، وَرَأَوُا اسْتِكْثَارَ غَيْرِهِمْ مِنْهَا اسْتِقْلَالًا، وَدَرَكَهُمْ لَهَا فَوْتاً، أَعْدَاءُ مَا سَالَمَ النَّاسُ، وَسِلْمُ مَا عَادَى النَّاسُ! بِهِمْ عُلِمَ الْكِتَابُ وَبِهِ عُلِمُوا وَبِهِمْ قَامَ الْكِتَابُ وَبِهِ قَامُوا، لَا يَرَوْنَ مَرْجُوّاً فَوْقَ مَا يَرْجُونَ، وَلَا مَخُوفاً فَوْقَ مَا يَخَافُونَ.

chapter: Divine reciprocity in gratitude, prayer, and repentance
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 435. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: It is not that Allāh, to Whom belongs Might and Majesty, may keep the door of gratitude open for a person and close the door of plenty upon him, or to open the door of prayer to a person and close the door of acceptance upon him, or to open the door of repentance on a person and close the door of forgiveness upon him.
arabicText: ٤٣٥. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): مَا كَانَ اللهُ لِيَفْتَحَ عَلَى عَبْدٍ بَابَ الشُّكْرِ وَيُغْلِقَ عَنْهُ بَابَ الزِّيَادَةِ، وَلَا لِيَفْتَحَ عَلَى عَبْدٍ بَابَ الدُّعَاءِ وَيُغْلِقَ عَنْهُ بَابَ الْإِجَابَةِ، وَلَا لِيَفْتَحَ لِعَبْدٍ بَابَ التَّوْبَةِ وَيُغْلِقَ عَنْهُ بَابَ الْمَغْفِرَةِ.

chapter: People oppose the unknown
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 438. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: People are enemies of what they do not know.
arabicText: ٤٣٨. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): النَّاسُ أَعْدَاءُ مَا جَهِلُوا.

chapter: Leadership as the test of character
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 441. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Governing power is the proving ground for people.
arabicText: ٤٤١. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): الْوِلَايَاتُ مَضَامِيرُ الرِّجَالِ.

chapter: Enduring little surpasses fleeting abundance
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 444. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: A little that lasts is better than much that brings grief.
arabicText: ٤٤٤. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): قَلِيلٌ مَدُومٌ عَلَيْهِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ كَثِيرٍ مَمْلُولٍ مِنْهُ.

chapter: Ignorance of religious law leads to usury
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 447. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Whoever trades without knowing the rules of religious law will be involved in usury.
arabicText: ٤٤٧. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): مَنِ اتَّجَرَ بِغَيْرِ فِقْهٍ فَقَدِ ارْتَطَمَ فِي الرِّبَا.

chapter: Diminishing wit through excessive joking
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 450. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Whenever a man cuts a joke he separates away a bit from his wit.
arabicText: ۴۵۰. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): مَا مَزَحَ امْرُؤٌ مَزْحَةً إِلَّا مَجَّ مِنْ عَقْلِهِ مَجَّةً.

chapter: Amīr al-mu’minīn on az-Zubayr's allegiance and his son's betrayal
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 453. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: az-Zubayr remained a man from our house till his wretched son ‘Abdullāh came forth. [1]
arabicText: ٤٥٣. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): مَا زَالَ الزُّبَيْرُ رَجُلاً مِنَّا أَهْلَ الْبَيْتِ حَتَّى نَشَأَ ابْنُهُ الْمَشْؤُومُ عَبْدُ اللهِ.

chapter: Amīr al-mu’minīn's view on the greatest poet
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 455. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, was asked about the greatest poet and he said:
arabicText: ٤٥٥. وَسُئِلَ (عليه السلام) : مَنْ أَشْعَرُ الشُّعَرَاءِ؟ فقال (عليه السلام) :

chapter: Amīr al-mu’minīn's view on the greatest poet
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: The whole group of them did not proceed on the same lines in such a way that we can know the height of their glory; but if it has to be done then it is the “al-Mālik aḍ-ḍillīl” (the mislead king).
arabicText: إِنَّ الْقَوْمَ لَمْ يَجْرُوا فِي حَلبةٍ تُعْرَفُ الْغَايَةُ عِنْدَ قَصَبَتِهَا فَإِنْ كَانَ وَلَا بُدَّ فَالْمَلِكُ الضِّلِّيلُ.

chapter: Amīr al-mu’minīn's view on the greatest poet
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: as-Sayyid ar-Raḍī says : Amīr al-mu’minīn means Imriu’l-Qays. [1]
arabicText: قال السيد الرضي: يريد امرأ القيس

chapter: Preferring truth over falsehood despite consequences
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 458. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Belief means that you should prefer truth (even) when it harms you rather than falsehood (even) when it benefits you; that your words should not be more than your action and that you should fear Allāh when speaking about others.
arabicText: ٤٥٨. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): (عَلَامَةُ) الْإِيمَانُ أَنْ تُؤثِرَ الصِّدْقَ حَيْثُ يَضُرُّكَ عَلَى الْكَذِبِ حَيْثُ يَنْفَعُكَ، وَأَلَّا يَكُونَ فِي حَديِثِكَ فَضْلٌ عَنْ عِلْمِكَ وَأَنْ تَتَّقِيَ اللهَ فِي حَدِيثِ غَيْرِكَ.

chapter: Backbiting as the weapon of the powerless
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 461. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Backbiting is the tool of the helpless.
arabicText: ٤٦١. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): الْغِيبَةُ جُهْدُ الْعَاجزِ.

chapter: Umayyad rule's inevitable collapse
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 464. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: The Banū Umayyah (Umayyids) have a fixed period (mirwad) wherein they are having their way. But when differences arise among them then even if the hyena attacks them it will overpower them.
arabicText: ٤٦٤. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): إِنَّ لِبَنِي أُمَيَّةَ مِرْوَدَاً يَجْرُونَ فِيهِ، وَلَوْ قَدِ اخْتَلَفُوا فِيَما بَيْنَهُمْ ثُمَّ كَادَتْهُمُ الضِّبَاعُ لَغَلَبَتْهُمْ.

chapter: Umayyad rule's inevitable collapse
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: as-Sayyid ar-Raḍī says: Herein “mirward” is a form derived from “irwād” which means to allow time, to wait for. It is an extremely eloquent and wonderful expression. It is as though Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, has likened the period of Banū Umayyah to a limited area meant for the training of horses for racing where they are running towards the limit, so that when they reach its extremity their organization will be destroyed. [1]
arabicText: قال السيد الرضي: وَالْمِرْوَدُ هاهنا مفعَل من الإرْوَاد، وهو الإمهال وَالإظهار، وهذا من أفصح الكلام وأغربه، فكأنه (عليه السلام) شبّه المهلة التي هم فيها بالمضمار الذى يجرون فيه إلى الغاية، فإذا بلغوا مُنقَطَعها انتقضَ نظامُهم بعدها.

chapter: Righteous leadership upholding religious integrity
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 467. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said in one of his speeches: A ruler came into position over them. He remained upright and made them upright till the entire religion put its bosom on the ground.
arabicText: ٤٦٧. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام) فِي كَلَامٍ لَهُ: وَوَلِيَهُمْ وَالٍ فأَقَامَ واسْتَقَامَ، حَتَّى ضَرَبَ الدِّينُ بِجِرَانِهِ.

chapter: Divine Unity and Justice Beyond Human Imagination
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 470. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, was asked on the Unity of Allāh and His justice, when he replied: Unity means that you do not subject Him to the limitations of your imagination and justice means that you do not lay any blame on Him. [1]
arabicText: ٤٧٠. وَسُئِلَ عَنِ التَّوْحِيدِ وَالْعَدْلِ فَقَالَ (عليه السلام): التَّوْحِيدُ أَلَّا تَتَوَهَّمَهُ وَالْعَدْلُ أَلَّا تَتَّهِمَهُ.

chapter: Grief over the Prophet's death precludes adornment
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 473. It was said to Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him: We wish you had changed your grey hair, O’ Amīr al-mu’minīn. Then he said:
arabicText: ٤٧٣. وَقِيلَ لَهُ (عليه السلام) : لَوْ غَيَّرْتَ شَيْبَكَ يَا أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ. فَقَالَ (عليه السلام) :

chapter: Grief over the Prophet's death precludes adornment
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: Dye is a way of adornment while we are in a state of grief.
arabicText: الْخِضَابُ زِينَةٌ، وَنَحْنُ قَوْمٌ فِي مُصِيبَةٍ!

chapter: Grief over the Prophet's death precludes adornment
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: as-Sayyid ar-Raḍī says: Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, is referring to the death of the Messenger of Allāh, peace be upon him and his descendants.
arabicText: قال السيد الرضي: يُرِيدُ وَفَاةَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ (صلى الله عليه وآله).

chapter: Justice and avoidance of violence in governance
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 476. When Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, put Ziyād ibn Abīh in place of ‘Abdullāh ibn al-‘Abbās over Fārs (in Persia) and its revenues, he had a long conversation with him in which he prohibited him from advance recovery of revenue. Therein he said:
arabicText: ٤٧٦. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام) لِزِيَادِ ابْنِ أَبِيهِ. وَقَدِ اسْتَخْلَفَهُ لِعَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْعَبَّاسِ عَلَى فَارِسَ وَأَعْمَالِهَا، فِي كَلَامٍ طَوِيلٍ كَانَ بَيْنَهُمَا، نَهَاهُ فِيهِ عَنْ تَقَدُّمِ الْخَرَاجِ:

chapter: Justice and avoidance of violence in governance
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: Act on justice and keep aloof from violence and injustice because violence will lead them to forsake their abodes while injustice will prompt them to take up arms.
arabicText: اسْتَعْمِلِ الْعَدْلَ، وَاحْذَرِ الْعَسْفَ والْحَيْفَ فَإِنَّ الْعَسْفَ يَعُودُ بِالْجَلاَءِ، وَالْحَيْفَ يَدْعُو إِلَى السَّيْفِ.

chapter: The learned's duty to teach precedes the ignorant's duty to learn
author: al-Sharīf al-Raḍī
englishText: 478. Amīr al-mu’minīn, peace be upon him, said: Allāh has not made it obligatory on the ignorant to learn till He has made it obligatory on the learned to teach.
arabicText: ٤٧٨. وَقَالَ (عليه ‏السلام): مَا أَخَذَ اللهُ عَلَى أَهْلِ الْجَهْلِ أَنْ يَتَعَلَّمُوا حَتَّى أَخَذَ عَلَى أَهْلِ الْعِلْمِ أَنْ يُعَلِّمُوا.
